verse.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, to the consecrated ones [in Ephesus] who are also faithful in Christ Jesus:
Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has blessed us with every spiritual blessing in the celestial regions in Christ.
For he chose us in him before the world was founded, so that we would be consecrated and unblemished before him. In love,
he marked us out in advance for adoption as his own children through Jesus Christ, according to the kind intention of his will,
to the praise of the glory of his grace, which he freely lavished on us in the Beloved.
In him we have liberation through his blood—the release from our false steps—according to the riches of his grace,
which he caused to overflow toward us. In all wisdom and insight,
he made known to us the sacred secret of his will, according to his kind intention which he set forth in Christ
as a plan for the administration of the fullness of the times: to bring all things together under one head in Christ—the things in the heavens and the things on the earth.
In him we were also claimed as God’s own portion, having been marked out in advance according to the purpose of the one who works out all things according to the counsel of his will.
This was so that we, who were the first to hope in Christ, might exist for the praise of his glory.
In him you also, when you heard the word of truth—the joyful news of your salvation—and believed in him, were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit.
This Spirit is the guaranteeing deposit of our inheritance, looking toward the full liberation of God’s own possession, to the praise of his glory.
For this reason, since I heard of the faith you have in the Lord Jesus and your love for all the consecrated ones,
I never stop giving thanks for you as I make mention of you in my prayers.
I pray that the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Father of glory, may give you a spirit of wisdom and revelation in the personal knowledge of him.
I pray that the eyes of your heart may be enlightened so that you may know what is the hope of his calling, what are the riches of his glorious inheritance among the consecrated ones,
and what is the surpassing greatness of his power toward us who believe. This power operates according to the working of his mighty strength,
which he exercised in Christ when he raised him from the dead and seated him at his right hand in the celestial regions.
He is now far above every ruler, authority, power, and dominion, and every name that is named, not only in this age but also in the one to come.
And God "subjected all things under his feet" and gave him to the assembly as head over all things.
This assembly is his body, the fullness of the one who fills all things in every way.
You were once dead in your deviations and your sins,
in which you formerly walked according to the Aeon of this world, according to the ruler of the authority of the air—the spirit that is now at work in the sons of disobedience.

Among them, we all once conducted our lives in the cravings of our flesh, carrying out the impulses of the flesh and of our thoughts; we were, by our very nature, children of wrath, just like the rest of humanity.
But God, being rich in mercy because of the great love with which he loved us,
even when we were dead in our deviations, made us alive together with the Christ—by grace you have been saved—
and he raised us up with him and seated us with him in the heavenly realms in Christ Jesus.
He did this so that in the Aeons to come he might demonstrate the surpassing wealth of his grace in his kindness toward us in Christ Jesus.
For by grace you have been saved through faith; and this is not from yourselves, it is God’s gift;
it is not from works, so that no one can boast.
For we are his masterpiece, created in Christ Jesus for good works, which God prepared beforehand so that we would walk in them.
Therefore, remember that formerly you—the nations in the flesh, who are called “the uncircumcision” by those called “the circumcision” (which is performed in the flesh by human hands)—
remember that you were at that time separate from Christ, alienated from the commonwealth of Israel and strangers to the covenants of the promise, having no hope and without God in the world.
But now in Christ Jesus, you who were once far off have been brought near by the blood of the Christ.
For he himself is our peace, who made both groups one and tore down the middle wall of the partition—the enmity—in his flesh.
He abolished the law of commandments expressed in decrees, so that he might create the two in himself into one new humanity, making peace,
and might reconcile both to God in one body through the cross, having killed the enmity by it.
And he came and preached the glad tidings of peace to you who were far off and peace to those who were near;
for through him we both have access in one Spirit to the Father.
So then, you are no longer strangers and resident aliens, but you are fellow-citizens with the holy ones and members of God’s household,
built upon the foundation of the apostles and prophets, with Christ Jesus himself being the chief cornerstone.
In him the whole building, being fitted together, grows into a holy sanctuary in the Lord;
in him you also are being built together into a dwelling place for God in the Spirit.
For this reason, I, Paul, the prisoner of the Christ, Jesus, on behalf of you—the non-Jewish nations—
assuming, of course, you have heard of the stewardship of God’s grace that was given to me for you:
that by a revelation the *mysterion* was made known to me, as I wrote to you briefly before.
By reading that, you are able to perceive my insight into the *mysterion* of the Christ.
In other generations, this was not made known to the sons of men as it has now been revealed to his holy *apostoloi* and prophets by the Spirit:
that the nations are joint-heirs, members of the same body, and joint-sharers of the promise in Christ Jesus through the *evangelion*.
I became a servant of this *evangelion* according to the gift of God’s grace given to me through the internal working of his power.
To me—the very least of all the holy ones—this grace was given: to announce the good news of the untraceable riches of the Christ to the nations,
and to bring to light for everyone what is the stewardship of the *mysterion* which has been hidden for ages in God, who created all things.
This was done so that the multi-faceted wisdom of God might now be made known to the rulers and authorities in the heavenly realms through the *ekklesia*,
according to the purpose of the ages which he accomplished in Christ Jesus our Lord.
In him we have boldness and access with confidence through his faithfulness.
Therefore, I ask you not to lose heart over my afflictions on your behalf, which are your glory.
For this reason, I bend my knees before the Father,
from whom every family-lineage in the heavens and on earth derives its name.
I pray that he would grant you, according to the riches of his glory, to be strengthened with power through his Spirit in your inner person,
so that the Christ may take up residence in your hearts through faith. And I pray that you, having been rooted and founded in love,
may have the strength to grasp, together with all the holy ones, what is the breadth and length and height and depth—
and to know the love of Christ that surpasses knowledge, so that you may be filled until you reach all the fullness of God.
Now to him who is able to do far beyond all things—exceedingly more than we ask or even imagine, according to the power that is at work within us—
to him be the glory in the *ekklesia* and in Christ Jesus to all generations, forever and ever. Amen.
I urge you, then, I the prisoner in the Lord, to walk in a way worthy of the summons to which you were called,
with all lowliness of mind and gentle strength, with patience, bearing with one other in love,
making every effort to guard the oneness of the Spirit in the binding-link of peace.
There is one body and one Spirit, just as you were also called in one hope of your summons;
one Lord, one faith, one *baptism*;
one God and Father of all, who is over all and through all and in all.
But to each one of us, grace was given according to the measure of the gift of the *Christ*.
Therefore it says: “Having ascended to the height, he led a captive procession of captives; he gave gifts to humanity.”
Now, what does “he ascended” mean except that he also descended into the lower regions of the earth?
The one who descended is himself also the one who ascended far above all the heavens, so that he might fill all things.
And he himself gave some to be *apostles*, some to be prophets, some to be evangelists, some to be shepherds and teachers,
for the purpose of equipping the holy ones for the work of service, for the building up of the body of the *Christ*,
until we all reach the oneness of the faith and of the full, experiential knowledge of the Son of God, to a mature manhood, to the measure of the stature of the fullness of the *Christ*.
This is so that we may no longer be infants, tossed by the waves and carried around by every wind of teaching in the rigged dice-playing of men, in their craftiness for the scheming of error.
Rather, being truthful in love, let us grow in every way into him who is the head, the *Christ*.

From him the whole body, being fitted together and held together through every ligament of supply, according to the operative power in the measure of each individual part, produces the growth of the body for its own building up in love.
Therefore, this I say and testify in the Lord: you must no longer walk as the nations walk, in the futility of their minds,
being darkened in their understanding, alienated from the life of God because of the ignorance that is in them, due to the calloused-hardness of their hearts.
Having become insensitive to pain, they handed themselves over to licentiousness for the practice of every kind of uncleanness with an insatiable greed.
But that is not how you learned the *Christ*—
if indeed you heard him and were taught in him, just as truth is in Jesus:
that you strip off, according to your former way of life, the old humanity which is being corrupted according to the desires of deceit,
and that you be renewed in the spirit of your mind,
and clothe yourselves with the new humanity, created according to God in the justice and holiness of the truth.
Therefore, having stripped off the lie, “Speak truth each one with his neighbor,” because we are members of one another.
“Be angry and do not sin;” do not let the sun go down on your provocation,
and do not give a foothold to the slanderer.
The one who steals must steal no longer, but instead must labor, working with his own hands at what is good, so that he may have something to share with the one who has need.
Let no rotten word come out of your mouth, but only what is good for building up as the need arises, so that it may give grace to those who hear.
And do not grieve the Holy Spirit of God, in whom you were sealed for the day of redemption.
Let all bitterness and rage and anger and shouting and slander be removed from you, along with all malice.
Become kind to one another, compassionate, graciously forgiving each other, just as God in *Christ* also graciously forgave you.
Therefore, become imitators of God, as dearly loved children,
and walk in the way of love, just as Christ also loved us and handed himself over on our behalf as an offering and a sacrifice to God, resulting in a fragrant aroma.
But sexual immorality and any kind of impurity or insatiable craving must not even be named among you, as is proper for those set apart for God.
There must be no obscenity, foolish talk, or crude wit—things which are out of place—but instead, thanksgiving.
For you can be certain of this: no one who is sexually immoral, or impure, or has an insatiable craving (which is to be an idolater) has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.
Let no one deceive you with empty words, for because of these things the wrath of God comes upon those who are characterized by disobedience.
Therefore, do not become their partners.
For you were once darkness, but now you are light in the Lord. Walk as children of light
(for the fruit of the light consists in all goodness, justice, and truth),
discerning what is well-pleasing to the Lord.
Take no part in the fruitless works of darkness, but instead even expose them.
For the things done by them in secret are shameful even to mention.
But everything exposed by the light is made visible,
for everything that is made visible is light. Therefore it says: “Wake up, sleeper, and rise from among the dead, and Christ will shine on you.”
So then, look carefully at how you walk—not as the unwise but as the wise,
buying up every opportunity, because the days are evil.
For this reason, do not be foolish, but understand what the Lord’s will is.
And do not get drunk on wine, in which there is wild dissipation, but be filled by the Spirit,
speaking to one another in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and making music in your heart to the Lord,
giving thanks always for all things in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ to God the Father.
Submit yourselves to one another out of reverence for Christ.
Wives, submit to your own husbands as to the Lord,
because a husband is the head of the wife just as Christ is the head of the assembly—he himself being the Savior of the body.
But as the assembly submits to Christ, so also wives should submit to their husbands in everything.
Husbands, love your wives, just as Christ also loved the assembly and handed himself over for her,
so that he might set her apart as holy, having cleansed her by the washing of the water with the spoken word,
so that he might present the assembly to himself in splendor, without spot or wrinkle or any such thing, but that she might be holy and blameless.
In the same way, husbands ought to love their own wives as their own bodies. He who loves his own wife loves himself.
For no one ever hated his own flesh, but instead provides nourishment and tender care for it, just as Christ does for the assembly,
because we are members of his body.

text.q: “For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife, and the two shall become one flesh.”

verse.text: This sacred secret is profound, and I am speaking with reference to Christ and the assembly.
Nevertheless, each one of you must love his own wife as himself, and the wife should see to it that she respects her husband.
Children, obey your parents in the Lord, for this is just.
“Honor your father and mother”—which is the first commandment accompanied by a promise—

text.q: “so that it may go well with you and you may live a long time on the earth.”

verse.text: And fathers, do not provoke your children to resentment, but provide for their growth in the discipline and instruction of the Lord.
Slaves, obey your earthly masters with fear and trembling, in the sincerity of your heart as you would obey the Christ.
Do not serve only when you are being watched, as those who merely want to please people, but serve as slaves of Christ who are doing the will of God from the soul.
Render your service with goodwill, as if to the Lord and not to human beings,
knowing that whatever good each person does, they will receive this back from the Lord, whether they are a slave or a free person.
And masters, do the same toward them. Give up the use of threats, knowing that the one who is both their Master and yours is in the heavens, and there is no favoritism with him.
Finally, be empowered in the Lord and in the strength of his might.
Clothe yourselves in the full armor of God so that you are able to stand against the schemes of the slanderer.

For our struggle is not against blood and flesh, but against the cosmic rulers, against the authorities, against the world-powers of this darkness, against the spiritual forces of evil in the heavenly realms.
Because of this, take up the full armor of God, so that you may be able to resist in the day of evil, and having accomplished everything, to stand firm.
Stand, therefore, having fastened the belt of truth around your waist, having put on the breastplate of justice,
and having shod your feet with the readiness that comes from the gospel of peace.
In every situation, take up the great shield of faith, with which you will be able to extinguish all the flaming arrows of the evil one.
Receive the helmet of salvation and the sword of the Spirit, which is the spoken word of God.
Pray in the Spirit at every opportunity with every kind of prayer and petition. To this end, stay alert with all perseverance and petition for all the holy ones.
Pray also for me, that a message may be given to me when I open my mouth, so that I may boldly make known the mystery of the gospel,
for which I am an ambassador in chains. Pray that I may speak it boldly, as I am required to speak.
Now, so that you also may know my circumstances and what I am doing, Tychicus, the beloved brother and faithful servant in the Lord, will make everything known to you.
I have sent him to you for this very purpose: so that you may know how we are and that he may encourage your hearts.
Peace to the brothers and sisters, and love with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
Grace be with all who love our Lord Jesus Christ with a love that never decays.
